Response: I think that if you got a B once, you can do it again, and if you really want it, which you clearly do, you can do anything! Aim for an A, you can do it!

Context: Thank you very much you've been very helpful God bless you have a good day
Response: And you too, good luck!

Context: Hello, is someone there?
Response: Hello, my name is Jonathan. May I ask who I am speaking to today?

Context: Hi Jonathan, I'm Keri.
Response: Hi Keri. How are you today?

Context: I'm feeling a little bit down today. I've been feeling a little bit down a lot lately.
Response: Oh no. I'm sorry to hear that. What do you think would be the cause of you feeling down lately?

Context: My ex-husband is moved in with his new girlfriend. They might get married.
Response: Oh Keri, that must feel awful. Was it a recent separation between you two?

Context: He started dating a few months after we split up. I don't know if this is the only person he's dated but I think so. He really moved on quick. Hi, are you still there?
Response: Yeah I understand what you're going through. I was in a similar position not too long ago. I had a hard time wrapping my head around how fast my ex could move on from what we had. How does it make you feel that he's trying to start a new relationship so soon after yours?

Context: It makes me feel like he didn't learn anything from our relationship or like he thinks he's better than me because he has someone new and I don't. I'm trying to take some time and be alone and be okay with being alone, which is good I think, but sometimes I feel really really lonely too. Like maybe I won't ever find anyone.
Response: That must feel really isolating. But working on yourself and becoming a better you is the only way to move on in a healthy manner. I think you're doing the right thing in waiting and learning to love yourself before you can open up and love another.

Context: Thank you! Exactly. But it is scary. I am guessing from your name that you identify as male (please forgive me if that is incorrect), so you might not understand what it feels like to be an older woman when your ex starts dating someone a lot younger. Men only get better and more desirable with age, not so for women.
Response: I might not understand that particular aspect, but self worth is still self worth no matter the context. I'd say try not to pay any mind to what he's up to. The grass always looks greener on the other side of the fence, but if you just focus on watering your grass (making yourself happy) then you'll have a much more fulfilling life.

Context: Haha, watering my own grass. That is a good way to put it. Thank you for talking to me for a few minutes. It makes me feel a little bit better to have someone agree that it is okay to spend time working on me, instead of thinking that it is sad or pathetic or an excuse. I really appreciate it.
Response: Oh absolutely Keri. Thanks for opening up and sharing your experience and feelings with me for just a few minutes. It was great to talk to you.

Context: Have a good night, Jonathan. :-)
Response: Happy Holidays Keri. Keep your head up!

Context: Hi. How are you?
Response: Good how are you doing?

Context: Ive had better days.
Response: Sorry to hear that, would you like to talk about it?

Context: I definitely would if you are willing to listen.
Response: I would be willing to do that

Context: I recently broke up with my girlfriend. We dated for two years. Just feeling blue.
Response: Break ups are the worst and feeling blue is totally understandable.

Context: I just need to do things to keep my mind off of it I guess.
Response: Reflection is important but healing and moving on which will take a little time is also important :-).

Context: You are so right. Any ideas on what I should do?
Response: Yes distraction is really good like taking up a new interest or reading a good book something like that. Any friends you can hang out with?

Context: I love reading. I might do just that. I have friends but with this pandemic it is hard to get together with them.
Response: Yes this pandemic has really been hard on social interaction and a good book you can be great distraction.

Context: I will do that. I might try some yoga.
Response: I am a Yogi Bear too and that is great for relaxation we did the angry dog and we barked lol in class yesterday We meet outside in the park even finding a remote space in a park might do some good you never know

Context: Lol. That is awesome. I already feel calm!
Response: Perfect :-)

Context: How long you been doing yoga?
Response: About 10 years I need it and it really does help ease the stress for me

Context: I'm so worried about my child who has so much homework and despite studying all night still is struggling.
Response: Hello! How are you feeling today?

Context: I'm a bit worried today and nervous.
Response: You are a very good parent to care and worry. I get it, I am a mom myself! Is your child doing digital learning or in person?

Context: It's actual a hybrid which is challenging. 2 days in school and 3 days at home.
Response: I can see how that is challenging Is it the same teacher for both?

Context: She has about 9 teachers and it's only 6th grade.
Response: That has to be really frusterating not having just one teacher you can go to in order to see if there is anyway to help your child not struggle

Context: I want to push her to keep working, but also want to give her a break from all the work. There is so much homework for a little child.
Response: Perhaps you can find out which classes your child struggles with and contact the teacher(s) or school to set up a conference? I know some schools even have peer tutors they say help pair students with!

Context: I'm thinking about tutoring possibly but being home and going to school it is so overwhelming already and to add tutoring to the list is another question for me.
Response: My children are five and eight. My eight year old spent about ten hours doing digital learning the other day when in-perosn was closed. I was so frusterated. I let her pick a movie and snack when she was done to reward her for finishing.

Context: Yes, we've had some months worth of snacks! Good thing for Burger King!
Response: Have you looked into any edulational or learning games? There is nothing wrong with rewarding your child for doing good in school or getting thier work done! :)

Context: That is a good idea. I wonder if they have one for vocabulary as that is the test tomorrow! She says she loves them. I'll have to look!
Response: I have done that with my kids. Technology is such a huge part of children's lives these days, they will play a videogame in a heart beat. I don't think they even realize they are learning sometimes!

Context: I have to do some research though and doing this x 3 kids is draining on top of work
Response: check out the website adventure academy. They have things for all ages/grades!

Context: Thanks so much for all your help! I'm feeling somewhat better and encouraged! Have a good day!
Response: I'm glad I could help! You too!

Context: Actually I have one more question
Response: okay, what is it?

Context: Do you think I should feel guilty for making her study?
Response: I think it is natural for a a parent to feel guilty when they are having thier child do something the child doesn't want to do. i think the benefits outweigh the negatives though. i think finding a way to make studying fun could be a win-win. you are a good parent for wanting the best for your child!

Context: Great advice. Thanks again. Take care!
Response: I think there should be more parents out there that care about their children and their children's future like you do. keep up the good work!

Context: Hi I am so sad my boyfriend was cheating and broke up with me when I found out. I don't think I can ever be happy again.
Response: I am sorry to hear that. reading your opening statement it sounds like you are now suffering from low self-esteem is that true?

Context: I have always had problems with low self esteem this makes it worse. I have lost interest in everything I can barely make myself go to work.
Response: do you think if you knew the reasons why the relationship ended it would help you deal with things a lot better?

Context: Maybe, why would he cheat? I have seen her she is not that pretty. I thought something was going on the last few months but he kept telling me everything was fine and that it was all my imagination.
Response: remember the fact that he cheated is not your fault. if he entered into a committed relationship with you you should not be cheating. if things aren't right you should be talking this through with you before deciding to move on and see someone else.

Context: I thought I was a good girlfriend, I was loyal, nice to his friends, kept the house nice, cooked for him, he never said he was unhappy he just started having to work nights and weekends a lot with no overtime he said he was salary now. I must just be unlovable.
Response: have you tried getting back out there and dating again? just because he didn't want to have an honest relationship with you, doesn't mean that nobody else does. also in my message above I have made a couple of autocorrect errors, apologies for that.

Context: I trusted what he told me despite my gut feeling which turned out to be right. I thought we were so perfect together, I don't want him back I could never trust him again, I am not sure I could trust any guy right now, I am so hurt and confused. I don't ever want to feel like this again.
Response: relationship issues, especially when they and suddenly can be one of the most stressful periods in an adults life. you are not alone in that other people have been through similar experiences themselves

Context: This was the first guy I ever lived with, I thought we would get married one day. How do people make it through the pain, it actually hurts.
Response: Do you have someone who you can talk to about this to support you?

Context: I have a couple acquaintances at work but I wouldn't want to discuss my personal life with, my mom said to have a good cry but I almost couldn't stop once I started. He was my best friend and who I talked to once we got together I didn't seem to need anyone else which looks like a mistake now. That is why I am here for support.
Response: Ok I understand. It is normal to be upset in a situation like this. When I ask if there is someone to talk to, I meant perhaps a friend or someone who has experienced a similar breakup. There are also support groups out there that can really help. Getting your emotions out and seeing that others struggle with the same issue may be a very good thing.

Context: Have you ever had a break up of a serious relationship or know someone who has? Does the aching inside ever get better? How long will it take?
Response: When I was younger, my girlfriend cheated on me. We were together for 4 years. For me, it turned to anger not sadness, I was so angry that she did that to me. I realised that if she was capable of doing this, it's better that I found out now, rather than when we were engaged or married. I loved her but after she cheated, I couldn't stand the sight of her. I completely understand the feelings you are experiencing. The good news is that I have since met someone wonderful, we have children and I am now very happy.

Context: I am sorry that happened to you but glad it turned out well in the end. You have a good point that it is better to know now than after we got married. I do have a nice neighbor who expressed concern when he noticed my boyfriend was gone. He said if I ever needed someone to talk to he was there. I thought he was just being nice. Maybe I should go talk to him some time maybe he was sincere.
Response: I think that that would be a good idea! for info, In terms of how long it takes to get over it. I have read a statistic that is takes half the length of the relationship to truly get over it. Personally I think it does depend on the person and how things end in terms of the breakup.

Context: Thank you for checking on that for me, I hope it is quicker I would hate to feel this way that long. I think I will go see him he is home right now. You have made me feel hopeful and that there will be an end to these feelings and maybe things will go as well for me as they did you. Thank you again.
Response: You are very welcome!

Context: Hi there, I badly need someone to talk with!
Response: hi whats on your mind today

Context: My partner left me after fifteen years and I simply do not know what to do.
Response: wow. that had to come as a shock. when did you find out

Context: Things had not been going well for a while but I had not realised just how bad it would be.
Response: i'm so sorry to hear that. how long ago did they leave?

Context: About two weeks. I have barely left the house since then. I just do not feel that I can go on.
Response: not leaving the house is the new normal for many of us right now. are you not leaving because you have nowhere to go or because you are feeling bad

Context: I think mostly the latter. I just do not want to face the world any more . I feel that everyone must know that I've been dumped and be laughing at me.
Response: you havve already made it two weeks by going one day at a time

Context: I did not really have any choice though . I do not see any future for myself now that we are separated.
Response: do you know brene brown and her work

Context: No I do not, who is that?
Response: she studies vuneraility and shame. please look for her TED talk and there's a great youtube video on empathy

Context: Thank you , I will. Right now I really need some sort of emotional support. I feel that the last fifteen years of my life have been a waste.
Response: i bring her up because what i sounds like is that you are feeling embarrassed because your partner made a choice that wasn't you in reality the choice they made wasn't about you, it was about them

Context: It is not so much that - it is that I feel that I dedicated the majority of my adult life to this relationship and now there is nothing left.
Response: you are left and you are enough. even if you dont feel like it right now you are enough

Context: I really do not feel like it right now. What was the last fifteen years all about? I wanted to have children with him and he refused but now I hear he is expecting a baby with another woman.
Response: a relationship is part of who you are. it isn't you

Context: But it is very difficult to try to strike out on my own again and I do not know if I even want to.
Response: it is hard. it sucks. but the voyage through the suck is going to be better for you than you may realize right now

Context: But I feel that I am facing middle age on my own and I really do not want to do that.
Response: you have survived 14 days without a bad relationship. keep on doing that day by day and before you know it, you will be on the other side of the bad feelings

Context: What happens if I just can't ever get over it though? Right now it's hard to see any sort of way through these feelings.
Response: yes, middle age is scary, but there are so many things you can do. ageism is out

Context: I feel I might have missed out on my chance to have a family of my own though, because I waited fifteen years and my partner would not go for that.
Response: please watch the cartoon animals and brene brown on youtube talk about empathy. find one of your friends who has been through the suck and let them help you find your path out.

Context: Most of my friends seem to be very happily coupled up right now. They are sympathetic but they do not really understand.
Response: i had an emergency ovary removal in my early 30s and didn't know if i woudl be able to have children. my doctor told me that the most important thing i could do was to be healthy becuse a healthy mother was what i could give my children even if i adopted them

Context: That sounds like very good advice from both you and your doctor. It is a difficult thing to have to confront though. I really do appreciate the fact that you have taken the time to talk honestly with me.
Response: you want an empathetic friend. nobody has gone through the exact same thing you have but the emotions are common ones. you will be ok, even if you dont feel that way now

Context: I hope that I will but am not sure. I really do feel rather better about things now though but - there's a long way to go. Thank you so much for your support!
Response: stay strong and stay safe

Context: Hi, my work situation is stressful
Response: Hi, I'm sorry to hear that. What's been happening?

Context: They barely acknowledge my presence and don't really talk to me except for an occasional hello
Response: That's not very fair. You deserve to feel valued at your workplace and it sounds like you don't feel that way.

Context: I know, I don't know why they act this way. is it something I have done. I'm stressed.
Response: You haven't done anything wrong. I have felt that way at work before too. I went to therapy to deal with my difficult work situation.

Context: therapy, is it maybe me, or should I bring it up with my boss.
Response: You could bring it up with your boss. That would be a very brave thing to do.

Context: I am worried that he would bring it up to my coworkers and I'd feel left in the open. I don't know the best course of action.
Response: Usually, bosses are required to keep those sorts of things confidential. You could request to speak to someone in Humane Resources, who is trained to help workers.

Context: I might just do that, although I am worried about escalating above my boss and above my coworkers. Maybe it may best to speak to my coworkers,
Response: You could speak to your coworkers and let them know that you would like a friendlier, more open work environment. Do you think that might help?

Context: It might, I don't know what set them off in the first place.
Response: That might be a good place to start when it comes to approaching them. Let them know your side of the situation and maybe they will understand.

Context: I think I will. Would you recommend me buying coffee and doughnuts?
Response: I think buying coffee and doughnuts sounds like a wonderful idea. It seems like you are really willing to help create a healthier work environment.

Context: yeah for my sanity. Thank you
Response: Of course. It's been nice to speak with you. I hope everything goes well for you.

Context: Thank you, goodnight
Response: Goodnight to you as well!

Context: Hello. Maybe you can help me calm down. I just found out that I'm losing my job in January. (1)
Response: Hello! I hope I can. I am so sorry to hear that. That's so rough. There are so many people going through this right now.

Context: Yes and that worries me even more. More people competing for the same jobs. (2)
Response: That's a fare worry but you can't be discourged. YOu need to think positively. You can use this as a time to reconnect with family and to get your resume together.

Context: I will have to do a new resume definitely. It's been awhile. (3)
Response: That's a good activity !! Do you have anyone who can help you with it?

Context: I'll have to think on that, I have a friend that might be able to help but it's been awhile for both of us (4)
Response: Do you have any hobbies you can work on while you're home?

Context: Well I don't think they are hobbies, but there are things that need to be done around the house. Guess I can keep myself busy at least (5)
Response: That's really helpfuL! staying busy is good. It's also really good time to reconnect with a loved ones and friends. You can try virtual connections.

Context: Yes, but I know I'll also have a lot of work to do to get ready to find a new job. I'm really hoping I can find one before I lose this one (6)
Response: HAve you been searching online sites? They post so many nowadays! If you spend a few hours a day. i'm sure that you'll find one in no time!!

Context: I looked at indeed and I did apply to one thing. But when it came back to me it said that 4970 other people had applied for the same job! (7)
Response: That happens but keep looking. It's a numbers game, so you have to just apply to a ton them once your resume is ready.

Context: I wish I knew how to make myself stand out more. So many people are out there looking for work. (8)
Response: There are online career counselors or resume helpers, they can help you figure out how to make your resume stand out. What industry are you in?

Context: I'm an accountant (9)
Response: So you're smart! You will defintiely find a job, i have total faith in you.

Context: Well, with numbers at least! I just worry about companies that aren't able to be open, well they won't need an accountant. (10)
Response: I think with the vaccine coming, things will be going back to normal soon enough! They already started giving the vaccine out.

Context: I know she would want me to be happy, but i don't feel joy anymore
Response: I understand. Sometimes it's hard to find joy. When do you think you starting feeling this way?

Context: Almost 2 years ago. I'm so lonely without her
Response: Sometimes, finding joy can be difficult. Especially when what we always turned to for joy is gone. But we can find comfort in little things. Is there something you have that gives you comfort? Even the smallest thing.

Context: When she was alive I felt like she was keeping me alive because i didn't want to put her through the pain of killing myself I feel good for a few minutes at a time but then it all seems pointless
Response: I believe we all have purpose in this life. I know that it's hard to live with-out the ones we hold dearly. I think a way we can keep them alive in our hearts is to pass on the good things about they did for us to others.

Context: You hit the nail on the head. I struggle to find purpose for my life. I have no kids & my anxiety keeps me from reaching out to people.
Response: I feel the same way, I get anxious around others as well. Maybe little steps are the best way. Sometimes all someone needs is a smile, even when we can't find our own, we can give one to others.

Context: Everytime I convince myself to seek professional help I fool myself into believing that this will finally be the time I will be able to fix myself. Of course I haven't yet I admit it has helped to be online & see that so many other people share my "symptoms"
Response: It's always hard to make that next step, but I believe you're closer than you think.

Context: I hope I hurry up. I feel like i'm wasting precious time I can't imagine ever feeling close enough to someone to call them a friend. I wish i could learn to love my solitude more
Response: You are not alone and you are right, time is precious, but it's okay to take to to grieve. Grief is a part of healing.

Context: Hello
Response: Hey! How can I help?

Context: So I don't know if you can see the topic of my problem like I can see on my screen? If not I'll explain
Response: Yes please do

Context: So I had a long time friend who recently blocked me from everything. The reason was I refused to hang out with her during covid and she questioned our friendship. Something she said was "It's selfish of me to work rather than spend time with a special friend." So I got upset and called her out. And in response she blocked me. And I'm more upset at myself because I wanted to tell her more about how horrible of a human being she is in general. But I cannot because she blocked me on everything.
Response: Have you explained to her that you NEED to work, and don't be upset with yourself because you did the right thing If your friendship was strong she will surely unblock you Give her time to cool down

Context: Yeah I did. And she just got more upset and said I was selfish. Like she's the type who would not back down and she's lost many friends and romanics partners that way So I feel like she's not going to unblock me and get back together. I'm just really upset because I want to call her off, not because I lost a friendship. Because screw her : ) I put up with her too much.
Response: You are not the one who is selfish here as you have done the right thing, and she will hopefully see that

Context: Should I go to her house and personally tell her how I feel?
Response: If she doesn't then you know she wasn't worth your time in the first place And no because this will make her more angry If she is aware of how you feel, she will come back in due time

Context: I guess I'm the type of person who has to tell people how I feel, otherwise I won't find peace. Do you have any other suggestions how I can get passed this?
Response: But for now, you should find other ways to make peace with yourself, for example, hanging out with other friends and that may take your mind of it and if that isn't an option simply keeping yourself busy may help

Context: But I can't really hang out with anyone because of COVID. That's how this whole situation started : )
Response: Maybe spend more time with work, or keeping yourself occupied with other things And she will come back if she really cared about your relationship in the first place

Context: Yeah, work can keep my mind off all this. And that's true. Thank you for listening to my ranting.
Response: Your welcome, there is always someone out there for you :)

Context: Aw thank you! You have a good one.
Response: You too!

Context: I should add (although it doesn't matter). I'm female married to a female.
Response: Hi there! I'm glad you're here

Context: hi
Response: So you're a female and you're married to a female? There's nothing wrong with that at all!

Context: Yes....well we are not living together now. We have to file papers for divorce
Response: I see. So you're actually legally married - didn't just have a commitment ceremony?

Context: Yes legally married
Response: Care to share what led up to filing for divorce?

Context: She cheated. And as far as I know is still with the person
Response: I can certainly understand how that feels. I have been in your EXACT situation.

Context: It's horrible and hard to move on for sure
Response: How long were you with her?

Context: Don't laugh Our one year wedding anniversary was this past Sat. Which I know I shouldnt be so miserable but I am. I think because like some people have told me we were still in our honeymoon stage. We were not fighting or having big issues....she just cheated
Response: I'm so incredibly sorry to hear that. You realize this behavior, these choices, are a flaw within her, and not you?

Context: It's hard to see that. I feel like a failure and not good enough Like why even get married in the first place if you are just going to cheat
Response: I can completely understand that as well. I blamed myself for quite some time as well.

Context: Ya you wish you could go back in time and change things or never get married lol
Response: When you go to bed at night, if you can drift off to dream with a clear conscience, then you're doing significantly better than her! What are you doing to take care of you during this time?

Context: Not much at all I feel like I'm in a funk and can't get out of it. My house is a disaster. I have a small business I am not in the mood to work on....I"ve been slacking in everything
Response: You are important! You matter! Why not do something that is relaxing to you?

Context: I do need to do something
Response: Do you have any post-it notes? Or paper and scotch tape?

Context: I do
Response: Here's what I've done for myself, and other folks that are close to me, going through struggles...

Context: ok
Response: Jot down inspirational messages and hang them up on the bathroom mirror, refrigerator, car, etc. "You matter", "You deserve the best", "You are the shiznit", etc

Context: the shiznet lol I will try that I need to do something
Response: Then, for the tasks that might be getting a bit behind, make a list, in order of importance -- and include a little reward for each task completed.

Context: Thats a good idea
Response: We have to take care of ourselves. After doing it for awhile, it just might become second nature to ya. And -- if continued, will show gals in the future exactly how you expect to be treated because they'll see you taking care of you (and not settling for nor accepting any doodie)

Context: I know I keep telling myself if I get my act together (physically, financially, etc) that I would attract better people....the kind I want to be with
Response: Whether you "have your act together" or not, it's up to you to determine who is worthy of being an active part of your life.

Context: Hi :)
Response: Hiya! =) How are you doing, today?

Context: I'm feeling really stressed about university, to be honest. I'm really struggling to find motivation to complete my assignments And it's stressing me out how little work I've completed even though deadlines are coming up.
Response: I totally understand that. Which year are you in?

Context: I'm in my final year, having to juggle my dissertation with what feels like a million other assignments
Response: Oh goodness, I can't imagine how stressful that would be. I've only gotten my associates, and I found that last semester to be a slough. But what kept me going was the relief and joy I would feel once I had that diploma in hand. Are there any study groups or classmates you can get together with, and basically make a night of it?

Context: I don't really have any friends on the course, I'm pretty shy and don't really feel comfortable talking to anyone. I kinda promised myself to make more friends in my final year, but obviously circumstances have changed :/
Response: Very true, this year made everyone's expectations and plans go out the window lol It might be time to put yourself out of your comfort zone, but start small. Are there any clubs or groups associated with your major? That way, you have some common ground to work with.

Context: I'm honestly not sure, I guess I've always been too nervous to reach out to anyone. I'll have to have a look.
Response: That sounds like a good idea =) Even if you can't hold club meetings on campus or have any gatherings, maybe they hold their meetings over video calls. One plus side to that, is that you don't need to have your camera on to participate.

Context: That's true. I also feel a bit nervous about my final grades, I've done well so far but just feel like this year might mess everything up.
Response: That's understandable, especially with how the past year has been. Everyone is on edge and everything feels so uncertain, but that's okay, because you're not alone =) You said you're doing well so far? Take pride in that, and focus on that. "If I've been doing well so far, I must be doing something right. I'll just keep doing what I have been, and everything should work out in the end."

Context: Yeah, I am really proud of what I've done so far but it just makes me worry that I won't meet my own expectations
Response: We can be our own worst critics, and that's never been truer than when we're facing a challenge. Self-doubt can be such a pain, but when I find I'm having trouble believing in myself and working toward my goals, I'll focus on what I already accomplished, and that helps give me that extra push to keep going I might be an internet stranger, but I'm proud of you, too. =) You've got one and a half semesters to go! You've got this! I believe in you! <3

Context: Thank you, it's actually made me feel a lot better! :)
Response: You're very welcome, I'm glad I could help =)

Context: Hello
Response: Hello how are you feeling today?

Context: Well. Not so good i just broke up with my girlfriend and she is packing her stuff to leave How are you doing?
Response: I am very sorry to hear that. Breakups can be rough. I'm great! Thanks for asking. Was this a mutual agreement?

Context: Well technically it was a mutual agreement but i feel like I dont want this to happen So what are you up to? Hello? Are you there?
Response: Was there a reasoning behind your decision? Sometimes we let our anger and emotions make our decisions for us.

Context: Well. Basically all started for jealousy and she saw a couple of text messages of my best friend and she misunderstood the conversation and since then its not the same. She doesnt trust me
Response: I see trust is a very important key factor in relationships and without it the relationship stays stagnant. Have you tried reassuring her that your intentions are pure and maybe gave her some words of affirmation that would let her know how you truly feel about her? Just because you guys are best friends all she sees in her head is that you're talking to another female. Maybe she also has her wall up and some insecurities that you can help her with.

Context: I tried in many way to help her with that and proving her that my feelings toward her was pure. I basically stop talking to my best friend to gain her confidence. But it did not work So it got to the point that nothing was the same So she decided to move away and gave us some spaces and think this out
Response: How long have you two been together? Sometimes moving on from a relationship and staying single from some time can give you time to reflect and work on yourself for yourself. You never know the two of you might come back together stronger than before cause space might be all that your relationship needs at this moment. I know this might be so tough for you but l want you to know that you are never alone and you can do this. Maybe read a new book or pick up a new hobby for the time being.

Context: We were together for two years Im trying my best to go through this I hope so. Thanks for all those words It really helps
Response: You're doing the right thing by talking to someone about it. We are not meant to be alone in our thoughts because it can be a scary thing. Bottling up emotions is also never good so for you to reach out is very good and the first step to maybe feeling a little better. I've been in your same shoes and trust me it doesn't feel good so just know I am here for you and you can talk to me in confidence.

Context: Well thank so much. You really help me a lot with every single word Well i have to go. Ill talk to you later
Response: Absolutely! You have an amazing day and keep you head up!

Context: Hello, how are you?
Response: Hi there! How may I support you?

Context: Well, I'm really upset with my friends.
Response: I am so sorry to hear that. Did something happen?

Context: Yes, they aren't taking COVID seriously.
Response: Oh that is so hard. I have family that isn't taking COVID seriously as well, and its so frustrating to see. Are you able to talk to them about your concerns?

Context: Yes but they get angry with me. I don't know how to get through to them,
Response: Some people express their frustrations in certain ways. Do you think there is another way to communicate with them? It's also okay to stand up for yourself and stand by what you feel is right.

Context: I really don't know I just haven't been seeing them at all but I see through social media that they have large parties but I do feel left out. It's a weird dynamic.
Response: It sounds like you're finding it hard to balance the isolation you feel during this pandemic, while you know it's the safest option, with the social gatherings your friends are having. Does that sound right?

Context: That's exactly right.
Response: that is such a hard position to be in. it sounds like you are doing your best by choosing to be safe and keep your distance.

Context: I'd like to think so but I wish they would too. It's hard to know what is right.
Response: I have found that having vitural movie nights, or going on socially distanced walks with my pals has been so helpful with staying connected. Is this something you think your friends would be willing to try?

Context: Yes, but they'll have their BBQs and parties anyway. They are having a group Thanksgiving and there will be a lot of people there. My husband and I feel bad that we aren't going, but we also know it isn't smart.
Response: I think a lot of people are going by the notion that you can't live your life in fear, and that they're going to have these big family gathering regardless of what is happening with COVID. The stats have shown that after holidays the cases have surged, for example, memorial day, 4th of July, labor day. But I think its important to remember the bigger picture that peoples lives are literally at stake and the people that disregard need to be more aware.

Context: We feel like after this is all over, they will still remind us that we were standoffish during this time. And I agree. The longer we put it off and don't take it seriously, the longer it will last.
Response: Can you tell them that that just isn't the case? You and your husband are making the right choice by staying home for the safety of yourselves and others. If I am correct, it has nothing to do with the fact that you don't want to see your pals and family! From chatting with you it sounds like your relationships with these people is incredibly important to you.

Context: Yes that's totally accurate. Yes they are. They are good people. They just think living for the moment is the bigger picture.
Response: I hope your friends can see how important they are to you and thats a huge reason why you're not seeing them.

Context: I think they do. They just think that this is a hoax.
Response: I know a lot of people that think the same thing. I have one friend who thought that, and they ended up contracting COVID. Thankfully she was ok, but after she got it she definitely didn't think it was a hoax anymore. I hope they understand the risk they are taking.

Context: That's scary. Yeah I don't think they get it.
Response: I am proud of the choices you are making and I hope you can take some comfort in knowing that you are doing your part in helping keep things under control. There is a strength in numbers and the more people who understand that the faster it can be controlled.

Context: Thank you. I hope it gets better. But anyway thank you for giving me the chance to open up.
Response: Yes of course, I hope this was helpful. You are doing the best you can and take pride in knowing that. :)

Context: I appreciate your willingness to listen and offer support. Life just is so hard right now
Response: Hi, How are you feeling right now?

Context: pretty crappy. Just lying in bed. never got out of my pjs today.
Response: Today must have been a hard day for you. It seems that there are some things that are really bothering you.

Context: The problem is I just don't really know how to feel better. I have much to be thankful for but don't seem to be able to really enjoy anything.
Response: I am sorry to hear that. Sometimes even for a person like myself I try to find things that I love to do to keep motivated. Do you have hobbies or things that you like to do for fun?

Context: That's what my husband keeps saying, too, but I just can't dredge up any enthusiasm for anything except I try to get out and walk because the fresh air is nice. I also knit, which is what I've been doing while lying in bed. But I can't think of the last time I really truly enjoyed myself.
Response: Yes, those are things that does make you day feel good fresh air, and knitting keeps you calm. Also, Have you tried buying a treat for yourself or going out for trip in the previous months to get some relaxation?

Context: Yes, the idea of a trip is enticing to me and I really hope to go visit my aunt in Michigan, perhaps in April. She is my mom's only sister and the only relative I have left from that generation and I love spending time with her. That was a good suggestion and I'll try to look forward to that.
Response: Yes, trips are amazing and especially when you visit someone you love spending time with makes even more worthwhile. Time that you get to spend with enjoying yourself and relaxing is something that needs to happen often so we can get back in the fight to be confident or strong to face our daily challenges.

Context: You have good insight and you are right, I need to focus more on enjoying the time I have with the people that I love. I'm also hoping some new meds will eventually help Thank you for listening God's blessings to you and your family
Response: Thank you and you are so welcome. I am glad I could help you. I hope that you have a wonderful time on your trip when you get to go. Also, I hope that many blessings come to you and your family as well.

Context: Do you have a background in counseling?
Response: Actually I do not have any background counseling, but I have been through a lot on my own. I have learn to enjoy life no matter what with those that I love and enjoy myself wholeheartedly.

Context: that's a huge gift. I wish I felt happier more often. I think i I think I would feel better if I had someone to talk to more often but I hate burdening my children or husband with my sadness
Response: Thank you. I believe you will find happiness in yourself. All you can do is take one day at time and learn all different ways to find what makes you happy.

Context: Yes, one day at a time is my motto! and I know God is with us. Thanks again!
Response: We all go through the sadness, and you are not alone. It just what we do next with after the sadness is gone makes it count.

Context: very true!
Response: Yes this is so true. You are so welcome. God is always with us even when we are not sure he is truly there. He is there and he helps us in many ways.

Context: Hai!
Response: Hello! How is everything going?

Context: very bad , I felt very depressed because I lost my job How are doing?
Response: I am sad to hear that, could you argument on why this happened and when? I am doing well, thank you

Context: I am a software developer due to covid-19 I lost my job do you refer me with your friends and collegeues.
Response: Since you are a software developer, isn't there a possibility for you to work from home? Many companies are offering their employees being able to work remotely I understand your depression, losing a job is not easy, but I am sure that you will get through this

Context: I have 3 years of experience , now I m working as a free lancer , earning very low
Response: I have heard of sites like fiver where people work on their own. With enough exposure, you can make a living out of it, and you get to be your own boss!

Context: Yes its good but not much earnings.
Response: I used to do art on fiver. Yes, you are right, it is not a lot, but hey, we have to start somewhere! If anything, you can always try and look for new job opportunities. I am sure you will see some amazing results with your 3 years of experience!

Context: I used to works as software developer , apart from job what are your hobbies?
Response: I like playing videogames and doing art. I find those activities to be relaxing.

Context: I am very bored to seek job , but I applied in many job seeking websites , Are you diagnosed by COVID-19 , what are the techniques you used to cope the current situation.
Response: I would suggest to wait some time, maybe one of them will call you back! And no, I have not been diagnosed with covid. I try to remain positive and remind myself that a vaccine will be developed soon.

Context: Thanks a lot buddy, I never expect from u , god bless you! I won't believe the vaccination is the effective measure .
Response: It has been a pleasure!

Context: Vaccination creates many side effect
Response: I agree, but don't you think those are worth given that you might gain covid 19 immunity? I personally plan on getting myself vaccinated as soon as I can

Context: are you believing our government too bad..
Response: That comes down to personal opinion, and is important that we respect each other choices Is there any other concern that I might help you with today?

Context: Do you like movies?
Response: Sometimes, as a way to distract myself yes

Context: I love to watch movies horror movies.
Response: If it helps you to get distracted and provides you with joy, absolutely!

Context: Do you smoke and drink alcohol?
Response: No, I don't find that to be healthy, and I don't enjoy them.

Context: My alcohol consumption is increased I can't cope myself from this depression , Sure I will leave it
Response: Relying on alcohol or any other addictions as a mean to cope with our problems is a bad idea. Make sure you don't abuse it's consumption. Do you have anyone you can talk to about it? Like a close friend or a family member?

Context: Thank you very much
Response: You are very welcome, talk to someone if you need to!

Context: please finish the conversation would you?
Response: You are the one that needs to do it!

Context: I have asked many question you just replied questions so please close the conversation
Response: If you read the instructions, you will see that you have to hit the "quit" button and answer a survey about my performance. I can not end the conversation, only the support seeker can. I am doing my job.

Context: hello anybody home?
Response: Hello! What would you like to talk about today?

Context: Hi, a little bit of anxiety of academics
Response: Can you tell me more about this anxiety?

Context: Well, I am nervous about a test I have coming up because I am wondering if I learned enough. ok?
Response: I am here, it seems that you don't feel like you've studied enough. Is that correct?

Context: That and because of the pandemic, I have not been able to connect with the teacher enough to know if I am completing things correctly. What can I do?
Response: It truly depends on the subject! There are online sites that provide free additional instruction Can you tell me what the class is?

Context: Its a math class. I have tried connecting with other students but many are just as confused as me, especially when it comes to showing the work part. You mentioned online sites, how accurate and helpful are those?
Response: Khan Academy is absolutely fantastic! It is extremely helpful and accurate since it is run by educators.

Context: Ok, I have to check that out as I have never heard of them. Did they have any reviews on how helpful they are in the math field?
Response: No but I am a former math teacher and I would give them to my students!

Context: Okay, that is great. That eases my anxiety a bit.
Response: I am so glad! I know online school is stressful but I think you can do it.

Context: Thanks. I am learning as I go and I am believe I am getting better. Just got to get use to it.
Response: I can recommend other resources if you'd like.

Context: Thank you, just a couple more if you have them.
Response: If this is an upper level math course, you can go to university sites! They always have lessons

Context: Okay, I will check that out. Thanks for your help.
Response: Of course! Did you have any other questions?

Context: No, that was all. Thank you for your assistance and providing me with some sources that can definitely help. Have a great day!!
Response: Good luck studying! You're capable of doing well!

Context: Thanks again for the words of encouragement. Goodbye!
Response: You can terminate the convo at any time!

Context: Hello
Response: Hello. How are you doing today?

Context: I have had better days.
Response: Would you like to talk about it?

Context: I could use someone to talk to.
Response: I would love to listen. Where would you like to start?

Context: Ive been feeling down since I broke up with my girlfriend of 5 years.
Response: I'm so sorry to hear that. Breakups are never an easy thing. I've also gone through those and they can make you feel awful.

Context: Im just trying to pick up the pieces and look to be positive.
Response: That's an excellent place to start. It's hard but I believe that you can do it. Do you have any family or friends that you've been speaking to about this?

Context: Thanks for the encouragement. That means a lot. Any suggestions on how I can get my mind off of it?
Response: Do you have any hobbies? I found that refocusing my energy into something I love doing really helped to bring my mood up.

Context: Great advice. I think Im going to start up taking yoga again and catch up on some books Ive been wanting to read.
Response: Yoga is an amazing stress reliever. I practice myself! I like your game plan and I think you'll start feeling the results sooner than you think.

Context: I think Im going to lay low on dating for a while.
Response: I completely understand. You'll know when you're ready again and it's great to take things at your own pace. All that matters is to do things when you're ready to.

Context: How long do you think I should take a break for?
Response: Honestly, that will end up being up to you. With my last big breakup, I didn't date for almost a year until I met someone. I would suggest at least a month or so to take some time for yourself and focus on yourself and what makes you happy so when you are ready to date again, you have a stronger sense of self.

Context: Thanks. That is great advice. I wouldnt want to go into something just for the sake of dating.
Response: Agreed. Taking the breather definitely helps.

Context: Sounds good. I will take your advice.
Response: I'm glad. I really wish you the best and I know that you're going to come through this stronger.

Context: Hi, I'm very depressed and sad. Please help Please help me I need help
Response: I'm sorry to hear that. Do you know why you feel depressed and sad?

Context: I think it's because of my poor relationships in life
Response: Have you tried taking some deep breaths to help you right now?

Context: I'll try and see if that calms me down.
Response: Tell me more about the poor relationships you have

Context: My family doesn't like me because I'm bad at school. My friends don't really like me or talk to me much. I feel alone.
Response: Are you able to talk to anyone about this? Someone who will at least listen to you talk?

Context: Not really. I try to talk to my friends but they avoid me.
Response: Maybe you could take one person aside by themselves and talk privately about your feeling?

Context: That seems like a good idea.
Response: Yes, just wait for the right time when the person is alone and ask if you could talk.

Context: I'll try to do that, thank you.
Response: Remember to take deep breaths, wait for the right time and see if that works for you. I know you can do it.

Context: Thank you so much. I feel like I can talk to someone now.
Response: I have faith in you. Is there anything else we need to talk about?

Context: No, I'm okay. I feel a little better. I hope I'll be able to talk to a friend soon Sad! Actually I need more help
Response: Remember, the outcome may not be perfect but slowly things will come together. Take it one step at a time.

Context: What step should I take after this one?
Response: See if the conversation gives you some insight on how things could be better. Maybe you could see things from someone else's perspective.

Context: Thank you so much!! You're helping me a ton
Response: Would you be willing to give it a try?

Context: Yes, of course~
Response: Also, if that works, then build from there. Remain calm and little by little talk about your concerns.

Context: That seems very, very smart. Thank you Im ok noq now
Response: Get some good sleep the night before you try having the conversation so you are at your best.

Context: Yes, I promise I will. I'm going to go rest now. Thank you again.
Response: You are welcome.

Context: Hi. How are you?
Response: Can I help you

Context: I'm worried that my job is in jeopardy. I've been really anxious these past few days.
Response: It is actually good. Why you are feeling

Context: My boss has been talking about money problems at the company. In the past few months, employees have been let go because of budget problems.
Response: So it should not impact you. Don't worry at all.

Context: I dunno. I think maybe it'll be my turn soon. Other people better than me, who have been there longer have gotten the chop.
Response: You should not listen your co-worker. Just listen your heart. Do your best.

Context: I have been trying to do my best, but I don't think it's good enough. The company is running out of money because of the pandemic.
Response: Start searching job meanwhile. Don't get panic. You have still lot of time. Be very patience.

Context: I've looked for a job. There doesn't seem to be much out there. Everybody else is looking too! The competition is fierce.
Response: I can understand. It happened with my sister too. She was also panicking like you, but I told her to apply and give interview. Still it is in process.

Context: I'll keep applying. I've been drinking a lot to deal with my anxiety.
Response: I can assure you don't worry at all. Keep yourself busy with friends. Go out with them and keep yourself busy. You will be fine soon

Context: I'm worried that I'm drinkng too much booze. My friends sit drinking with me and tell me not to worry about work. But I can't stop worrying.
Response: Do meditation or yoga will help you.

Context: Good afternoon. Hope you are surviving he virus
Response: Hello, I hope you are as well. Is anything the matter?

Context: I am just looking for a friend to chat with. Just feeling lonely.
Response: I feel the same way. I cant wait for life to be normal again. It has been a hard year.

Context: The virus has stopped people from meeting. What about you? I don't know if life will ever be normal again.
Response: Do you live alone? Do you mean meeting new people or getting together with people you already know? I am naturally an introvert, so it honestly didnt bother me the first month or so... but I'm so over it now. I wish I had taken advantage of freedoms we had before all of this.

Context: I currently live in a place that is totally lonely. It is not because of the virus but just because people aren't able to reach out or there are no viable places to meet and greet. The freedoms are still there but the fear of getting the virus stops people from normal life.
Response: I think it will pass eventually, but who knows when. It feels like every where you look things are falling apart sometimes. What kind of place do you live in?

Context: Currently I live in a hotel getting ready to travel to another state. What about you?
Response: You're so right.... I miss not fearing the virus. I don't fear at as much as I did, but I fear giving it to a loved one. Do you travel a lot for work?

Context: No for personal reasons. I just find the disparity between wearing the mask in some states is not as demanding s others. Here the masks do not seem to be mandatory, but 100 miles and it is necessary.
Response: Some people are on lockdowns, I'm nervous about our income in the next few months with the talk of more stay at home orders. I know it feels like itll be like this forever but I really dont believe it will. It may get worse before it gets better but I think things will go back to normal eventually.

Context: I think we are in a long period of recovery because the country has too many laws in different states that are causing demands on the health system.
Response: I have traveled states recently and the difference is crazy! I went through Tennessee, missippi, and alabama and stopped a few times.. some places are just going on like normal, hardly any masks.. in arkansas you never see anyone indoors without one.

Context: Too much politics behand the virus and helping the people. Florida is mandatory, but Georgia is lacks. Tennessee is mandatory but other states are not as caring.
Response: I totally agree. And you never know what is true or not. Its stressful. I'm in georgia now and most people do not wear them unless asked. I've only been required to at dr appointment. Is it mandatory where you are now?

Context: No except at WalMart Georgia has a high virus rate, yet no mandatory masks.
Response: There are signs here but half the shoppers dont wear them. I think people here dont fear it as much as other places.

Context: There is no mandatory requirement for the mask, especially at the convenient stores. You walk in and the employees don't even wear them. The screens aren't going to stop the spread.
Response: So you travel because you want to? YES the gas station closest to me.... I have been in there every other day recently and never seen a person in a mask. The employees at the dollar general close to me dont wear them either. I dont think it will either honestly. Sometimes I feel guilty if I'm not wearing one. The uncertainty of everything gets to me.

Context: I wear mine for my own protection. What about you? I have to travel to Virginia soon and I want to arrive clean I am only traveling now because of issues otherwise I would be in FLorida I miss the bneaches
Response: I wear mine to protect other people.... I do have health issues that could complicate things but I dont thing it will stop me from getting it. I MISS THEM TOO. We were in PCB last summer and everyone was freaking about the water lol. we had no idea what was coming

Context: I understand for protecting others, but when the people around you ignore the virus and refuse a mask, they aren't concerned about you. What part of Florida. I was near Stuart and Jensen Beaches. Masks are mandatory otherwise no entry at the stores
Response: well I hope you are able to connect with people soon.. I think these are cool.. Its nice to talk to new. Youre right generally people dont care for other people, but I'm not that way. Panama City Beach. new people*

Context: Hello there
Response: Hi, how are you?

Context: I am Ok but starting to get a little bit worried about my work situation.
Response: I see. Can you tell me about what's happening with you at work that's bothering you?

Context: I work on projects and have a role for the next couple of months but I will need to look for work and am struggling to find something. I think this is due to covid. I'm afraid I'll lose my house
Response: It sounds like you're in a tough spot right now, not knowing what your future will be like.

Context: Yeah that's right. It's the uncertainty that's making me fearful.
Response: Yes, I can sense that you're quite anxious and fearful.

Context: I don't know what to do for the best and how to really get myself out there again.
Response: I imagine it must be difficult. From a practical standpoint, have you tried to reach out to people you can trust in your personal and professional network to see whether there are opportunities for work?

Context: That is a really good suggestion I have tried agencies but not actually made a concerted effort with my network. I think I'm in panic mode!
Response: It's understandable that you're feeling a sense of panic now. I imagine everyone would feel that way.

Context: Yeah true, the news is all soon and gloom and there doesn't appears to be support for those that are still in work. or is there?
Response: Yes, the news can be depressing. Is there a support group of some sort in your area?

Context: I haven't checked, I suppose I can find one online. Have you ever used one personally?
Response: I have in the past. It's more common than people think.

Context: I'll give it a try and see if it helps. Thanks for the suggestion. Hopefully with my network I'll find something more permanent in future. I hope!
Response: I hope you'll find something too. I've found that when you reach out, people can be more willing to help than you expect.

Context: That's great advice. I'll stay positive and keep trying. I suppose many people emails are in a similar position.
Response: Yes, times are tough for many people.

Context: Thanks for your help. It has been good to talk it through and also thanks for the suggestions.
Response: You're welcome. Happy to help.

Context: Hi there, how are things?
Response: Hi Can I help you

Context: Yes trying to get over the passing of my aunt a week ago.
Response: You tell me That's so sad. I am sorry!

Context: Thanks, it is actually a week today. My mother has taken it particularly hard, they were best friends
Response: I can understand very how your mom is going through hard time.

Context: Thanks. I really have not had much time to grieve myself since she is my first priority.
Response: Time will heel her. That I can assure you.

Context: Do you have any suggestions what I might try to cheer her up? After that I can worry about myself
Response: Tell her to meditation or yoga in the morning. This will definitely helped and her mind will be busy

Context: That might be ok. I know she likes Neil Diamond. Maybe get some of that playing while she meditates.
Response: That is wonderful idea too . She will recover soon

Context: Now what should I do for myself after she is better?
Response: Be busy with your daily routine. Planning is the key

Context: I thought about trying some daily exercise like just walking around the block a couple times with my dog.
Response: Good idea! You can take your mom along with you in the park. She will recover soon.

Context: I thought about redecorating her house a little bit, they lived together for a long time maybe a change of scenery would do some good
Response: Yes, try to do all thgings. But do one by one. That is my advice for you

Context: Ok, well thanks for your help
Response: Your welcome

Context: I think when I start eating a little better things will improve too.
Response: Start eating more fruits like me. I am trying to eat healthy.

Context: Ok good idea, Thanks
Response: Your welcome

Context: HI I have such trouble sleeping
Response: Hello! How is life treating you right now?

Context: Ok I guess but I can not shutt my brain off and relax
Response: I see .. so I hear you saying that you are suffering from very bad anxiety?

Context: I guess, that would be what it is called I just always thought I am unable to sleep???
Response: Ah I have had this problem myself. Have you consulted with your doctor?

Context: No but I have been taking melatoning or pm medication but it does not really help either
Response: I am not sure what sort of medications they are - are they specifically for insomnia?

Context: Melatonin, for sleep...and like tylenol PM... I also have taken over the counter sleep meds all of them are over the counteer
Response: I tried those too but did not find them very effective, did you?

Context: no i do not, but i do not want a prescription afraid of getting hooked
Response: There are some sleeping pills out there that are not addictive, or at least I believe so

Context: I am even worried that you could get hooked with the over the counter stuff...it is a rough spot, I see all the night time TV shows...
Response: I think the over the counter things are generally considered safe but you could ask the pharmacist.

Context: I guess I could...maybe it is age...
Response: How old are you?

Context: I am 56 years old
Response: Ah, I am in my mid forties, everything starts to get harder health wise after that age don't you think?

Context: I know it...LOL... things hurt i never even knew I had....
Response: And sleeping problems start emerging, sigh. Do you get a chance to nap during the day?

Context: NO I have never been able to sleep during the day unless I was sick, I work fulltime also. so i leave my house at 6 am and get back at 3 pm then dinner and household...
Response: Sounds like you have a very packed life. Maybe you need more time to yourself to relax?

Context: Maybe just not sure how to get to that point
Response: Is there anyone in your home that you can discuss this with? Spouse?

Context: LOL...you are funny my husband is self employeed I do all his paperwork, and he is not the empathetic kind...
Response: I hear you on that one too :(. I think you are being put under unnecessary stress

Context: I think you are right and I am sure I put a lot on that myself by trying to do everything right
Response: What are the chances of you doing something just for y ourself soon? A spa day maybe?

Context: I think I will do that ..it as good to talk to you....thanks for letting me vent
Response: No worries, I have a couple of minutes more to spare if you'd like to talk about something else :)

Context: NO I do appreciate it I got to get a shower...thanks again
Response: No problem at all :) can you just wait for the fifteen minute mark before pressing quit, thanks and have a great day

Context: You too, you are very nice
Response: It's a living :D

Context: Hi, I'm Anna
Response: Hi there, how is life treating you right now? I am Jo, it is nice to meet you! Is there anything you'd like to talk about today?

Context: Going through a break-up. My 3rd one this year.... Nice to meet you too It suckssssss
Response: Gosh you've been busy :). I am sorry to hear that though - I know how much it hurts when you split with someone, especially if it was not consensual. It's a lousy time of year for it too, isn't it?

Context: I feel like a piece of crap, and childish at that. I can't maintain any of my relationships. I think I'm going to be alone for the rest of my life.
Response: That is a defeatist way to talk! Just because a couple of relationships fail does not mean that you will never be able to find happiness.

Context: Well, if past experience has any powers of prediction. I get super clingy, and do this push and pull thingy, where I break up and call them names, and then become so embarrassed it's hard to even bring it up. my last boyfriend said he thought i had borderline disorder
Response: I have been in that position too. I hate it when I realise that I am not being rational but I can't seem to stop myself sometimes and this has sometimes let to problems with my inter personal relationships

Context: Yea, that definitely seems to be part of my problem. I really thought he was different, too. And when he broke up with me, I tried to get him to spend the night with me in a hotel, and I felt so pathetic because I was practically begging for sex I think I am an addict.
Response: I hear you on that one too! It's horrible to feel that you are losing your self respect but I suspect that we've all done it at some point. Have you considered getting some counselling?

Context: Sigh.. yes. I have seen several. I also take meds from a psychiatrist.
Response: I hear you saying that they are not really effective, is that true?

Context: Well... one told me that I should be put down like a dog to my face. so, yea
Response: Okay .. I hope you reported him!!

Context: I didn't. I was younger then. who knows. not gonna lie. maybe they're right. Sometimes I think I'm a psycho. My last therapist was always doing deep breathing exercises. It didn't help. I also have a lot of anxiety. A LOT! I even got an emotiona support dog
Response: I understand that as well .. I am on medication for it. A dog is a wonderful thing to have! Do you feel that it has helped you?

Context: Yea, he's my best friend. At least I have one boy who has to stick around. He's on a tight leash
Response: Dogs are very very loyal. They never cheat on you or walk out on you!

Context: So trueee :) I just wish I wasn't such a freak.
Response: I think you are probably not anywhere near as bad as you think you are you know :). Anyway I wish you all the very best for the New Year and hope that things pick up for you soon!

Context: Alright, bud. Thanks. You, too
Response: take care! (you need to quit first and take the survey .. I can't :))

Context: Can you help me?
Response: sure, what seems to be the problem

Context: I can't figure out why my friends don't understand why I want to keep a bit distant during COVID
Response: I had the same issue with my friends as well

Context: Really? What happened?
Response: We stopped getting together and going out places cause they were all closed

Context: Yes, that happened here. But they still wanted to come over despite government orders limiting gatherings.
Response: We now have weekly video call meetings instead, it helps us stay connected

Context: That sounds like a good idea. Is it hard to do?
Response: Not at all, we use a program called Skype, that's free. You can use it on your phone or PC

Context: My friends want to go out all the time. How can we connect during a Skype?
Response: Pick a time you'll both be available, and you'll both need the program. It's quite easy to use and there will be youtube videos that'll help you set it up, should you need it

Context: Do you do any activities together over Skype?
Response: We usually just chat about our week or get advice on normal things, sometimes we'll play a drinking game and be goofy together.

Context: Are there other games people can play together on Skype because I don't drink?
Response: Drinking isn't a requirement, usually we'll just chat if we don't feel like drinking

Context: I just want to connect and please my friends but it is hard to not have any physical contact and only be online.
Response: I can understand that and it's definitely frustrating. But it'll be so much better once you can see other other again, cause absence makes the heart grow fonder

Context: Wow, I didn't think of it that way. That puts a positive twist on it.
Response: Yes, I always like to look for the positive in any given situation

Context: I believe that I can get over this time in my life but I need support.
Response: What are you having a problem with?

Context: My husband has cancer. I have been really depressed.
Response: I understand how you are feeling. My mom had cancer. It really helped me to join a support group.

Context: So how do you keep going without crying? How do I find a support group? I live in a rural place.
Response: Crying is natural. You have every right to have those feelings. Don't try and stop yourself from crying.

Context: Ok. How do I not cry in front of him?
Response: There are online support groups you could get involved with.

Context: Yeah but where do I find them?
Response: You can google - online cancer support groups.

Context: It makes it tough because I don't make as much money as he does/ What kind of cancer di your mother have?

Context: what should I do?
Response: Can you tell me a little more about your situation so I can better understand?

Context: My friend's husband is spreading false rumors about me because my daughter moved up in soccer and theirs didn't. He's telling people it's because I'm having an affair with the coach - who is married! This is not true! My daughter is a better soccer player. what do you think I should do?
Response: It sounds like your friend's husband might be jealous of your daughter, or embarrassed that his daughter did not get moved up also. Have you spoken to your friend about this?

Context: I haven't yet. I was deciding whether or not to talk to him directly or just her or both at the same time. I am really upset and don't want to lose her. I know people get all crazy about their kids and sports. I agree that he's jealous but his daughter isn't really that good - didn't make the school team either. Should I talk to my friend alone first?
Response: It depends on the depth of the relationship between the three of you. How long have you all been friends?

Context: About 6 years. Our daughters are also friends, too. I am single so I don't care about the husband but also don't want to come in between their marriage.
Response: Yes, that is a difficult situation to know how to handle. It could be in your best interest to leave your friend out of it so she doesn't feel stuck in the middle or forced to take sides. However she could view the opposite as you going behind her back.

Context: yes that's true. I don't want to go behind her back but also don't want to get her involved. I could have the coach talk to the dad maybe?
Response: Yes, coaches are a great resource for life's dilemmas. Perhaps another option would be to casually mention something to him in passing, like at one your daughters games as to avoid any big blowups or emotional exlosions.

Context: Oh that's a good idea - in public and not making a big deal about it - and before she moves teams and rumors get worse.
Response: That is exactly right. Each person handles and avoids conflict differently and you have the important roll as leader in all of this. There is a chance he is not aware of the strain this has put on you emotionally and he could respond well to not being called out by someone else. Does that make sense?

Context: it does - but doesn't seem that he cares about my strain on my life since he's the one spreading such lies about me. I just hate him!
Response: I can understand how you would feel like he doesn't care about the strain it's placed. Can I ask, are your daughters aware or involved in these rumor's? This could make a difference in how you could respond.

Context: I did tell her because I was so mad when another mom told me. She doesn't care. She still likes the friend but not the dad.
Response: Sounds like your daughter has a good head on her shoulders. Maybe there's something to be learned from her reaction to all of this. I understand how hard this has been for you so perhaps simply ignoring the rumors will allow you to heal quicker, by simply being the bigger person. Because rumors are just rumors, after all. You and your daughter know the truth and that's all that matters.

Context: yes you're right. I will try to just ignore. And figure out what to do with my anger over all this? Maybe go for a run and also avoid him?
Response: If he knows you know and you rise above with a smile on your face, that could show him that you are more mature than his childish games, and that you mean business. By taking ownership of your own feelings and emotions, you might find that will squash your need to let out any anger towards him.

Context: oh I like that and I am willing to try. I am tired of wasting my energy being so angry at this man who like you said is jealous which is HIS problem and shouldn't be might, right?!
Response: Exactly. Let his problems remain his. You worry about you and your daughter and he can watch from a distance confused at his failed attempt to reflect his own dissatisfaction with life onto you didn't work. I think you will feel freed of any stress this has caused.

Context: Hey there, how's it going?
Response: I am doing good. How are you?

Context: I'm ok, I could be better. I'm trying to find a job currently.
Response: What kind of jobs are you looking for?
